main event: Multiple UFO sightings were reported in Newburgh, New York in October 1956, involving various observations of circular, white or red-lighted objects moving up and down, hovering, and disappearing at tremendous speeds.
interesting points: Multiple individuals observed a very bright object about the size of a car hovering about 2000 feet above ground, which suddenly shot straight up at an unbelievable speed.
A civilian witness described the object as oval in shape, larger than a star, with no exhaust or flame, and unlike any conventional aircraft.
The witness, who was watching television in a parked car, observed the object through the windshield along with his wife for about 5 minutes.
A Civil Defense official, who was a first observer, reported sighting an object resembling a circular saucer moving at tremendous speeds and leaving a trail of grayish smoke or vapor.
Three separate persons observed an orange-yellow circular object moving rapidly from east to west, disappearing within 3 to 5 seconds, leaving no trail behind.
sighted object: various circular, white or red-lighted objects
photographs: no photographs included in the report
